title: Celebrity X Factor viewers stunned by Chaser Jenny Ryan's secret vocals
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The Chase's Jenny Ryan has shocked the nation with her secret singing talent.

The 37-year-old Chaser from the hit ITV game show sent social media wild as she blasted out her own rendition of Queen's Somebody To Love on the X Factor : Celebrity tonight.

The star, also known as The Vixen on The Chase , opened with an explanation on her role on the game show. She said: "‘I’m a professional crusher of dreams."

"So Simon and I have a lot in common already. It has taken all of my 20s and most of my 30s to get to this point where I am very happy with who I am."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

She added: "Part of that was discovering the power of music, it brings me such joy, it’s a time for me to try and share what I’ve got with the world."

Not only did Jenny leave viewers at home mesmerised with her incredible singing talents, The Chase star was given a standing ovation by Louis Walsh.

The 67-year-old Irish music manager praised: "Wow Jenny where did all that come from? You have just got a great voice."

While Nicole Scherzinger excitedly screamed: "Jenny, you were like, 'I don’t really care y’all… Welcome to my back garden'."

(Image: ITV)

The former Pussycat Doll star continued: "To know that you’re like a human encyclopaedia or whatever – when you opened your face hole and that came out, I was like, 'yeah!'"

And Simon, ever the subtle judge, remained more calm but expressed: "good for you."

Avid fans flocked to social media to comment on Jenny's secret vocal talent.

One user tweeted: "Wow Jenny. What an amazing voice."

While another commented: "Brilliant Jenny! Loved it! You don't have to be cocky or loud, just know yourself."

(Image: ITV)

A third announced her support for The Chase star: "Wow Jenny is absolutely amazing - backing her 100% That performance was incredible."

Another shared: "Woah Jenny. What a voice! You go girl!"

One user even added that Jenny's performance affected her emotionally. She wrote: "Jenny just gave me goosebumps. WOW how did that just happen?"

The Bolton brainiac recently revealed that she might not have been doing the new version of the singing show if it wasn’t for her TV colleague Bradley Walsh.

Speaking ahead of her appearance on the programme, she said: "Bradley is very proud. From the time I joined The Chase he's always encouraged me to push myself and to explore whatever opportunities I am given.

"That's one of the reasons I accepted the invitation to audition in the first place. I've held myself back a lot for a lack of confidence. And that situation you push yourself forward to take the challenge. It’s a learning experience whatever happens."

She added: "Brad has a record deal, he’s got albums out, he’s got Doctor Who, and he presents every other programme sometimes when you’re watching of a weekend.

"I’m sure he won’t mind me saying he’s got a couple of decades on me. I’m sure I’ve got the energy to keep that going."

*The X Factor: Celebrity returns tomorrow on ITV
description: The Chase star Jenny Ryan performed an incredible rendition of Queen's Somebody To Love
